update.description:
The propshop needs 4 pictures for each model. This pull-request contains a plugin and ruby script that will automatically generate these images.

I found that OGRE <1.9 does not allow anti-aliasing in texture buffers. I put in the necessary changes to support OGRE 1.9, which will create nicer images. Ogre 1.9 is not mandatory.

To try the ruby script:

`gzprop <model_directory>`

For example:

`gzprop ~/.gazebo/models/pr2`

A tarball should be created in your current directory that contains the model and a set of images in a `meta` subdirectory.

This PR is  [ABI/API compatible](http://gazebosim.org/compat_reports/pr_734.html) with gazebo-2.0. The goal would be to put this into gazebo-2.1.
update.title: Plugin to create pictures for thepropshop.org

content.raw:
if the dir is not empty, this condition becomes false and goes on to evaluate the `elsif` condition which causes ruby (version <1.9) to complain again about undefined method `exist?`

so how about 

```
#!c++

if RUBY_VERSION < "1.9" 
  if DIR[modelDir].empty?
```
content.html:
if the dir is not empty, this condition becomes false and goes on to evaluate the elsif condition which causes ruby (version <1.9) to complain again about undefined method exist?

so how about 

if RUBY_VERSION < "1.9" 
  if DIR[modelDir].empty?

content.raw:
This will not work when ogre version becomes 2.0 right?

Just reviving @caguero 's proposed change on this version check.
 
`if OGRE_VERSION_MAJOR > 1 || (OGRE_VERSION_MAJOR == 1 && OGRE_VERSION_MINOR >= 9)`

Same applies to other ogre version checks in this pull request
content.html:
This will not work when ogre version becomes 2.0 right?

Just reviving @caguero 's proposed change on this version check.

if OGRE_VERSION_MAJOR > 1 || (OGRE_VERSION_MAJOR == 1 && OGRE_VERSION_MINOR >= 9)

Same applies to other ogre version checks in this pull request

content.raw:
replacing 

`if !Dir.exists?(modelDir)`

with 

`if Dir[modelDir].empty?`

solved the problem for me.

Same goes for [gzprop:46](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/734/plugin-to-create-pictures-for/diff#Ltools/gzpropT46)
content.html:
replacing

if !Dir.exists?(modelDir)

with

if Dir[modelDir].empty?

solved the problem for me.

Same goes for gzprop:46

content.raw:
In my laptop everything works but on my pc I get the following error:

```
#!c++

/home/caguero/local/bin/gzprop:31: undefined method `exists?' for Dir:Class (NoMethodError)
```

I believe ruby 1.9 is required and I have 1.8.7. We have to remember to use at least 1.9.x as a ruby dependency.
content.html:
In my laptop everything works but on my pc I get the following error:

/home/caguero/local/bin/gzprop:31: undefined method `exists?' for Dir:Class (NoMethodError)

I believe ruby 1.9 is required and I have 1.8.7. We have to remember to use at least 1.9.x as a ruby dependency.

content.raw: ABI compatibility only breaks if existing functions are changes. It's safe to add new functions.
content.html: ABI compatibility only breaks if existing functions are changes. It's safe to add new functions.

content.raw: How did you verify ABI compatibility? Any changes to class definitions in header files can potentially break ABI, as I found out with [sdformat](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/issue/21/gazebo-crashes-when-spawning-model-after). I'm looking at Camera.hh, RenderEngine.hh, Scene.hh
content.html: How did you verify ABI compatibility? Any changes to class definitions in header files can potentially break ABI, as I found out with sdformat. I'm looking at Camera.hh, RenderEngine.hh, Scene.hh
